authors: Figure 1. Mapping climate change imagery with Google Images. Source: Digital Methods Initiative Fall Data Sprint. Date: 21-25 October 2013

sections.html: The graphic is a treemap, which communicate through a visual hierarchy the distribution of categories in the image set. Those that are more recurrent occupy a larger area in the graphic.
sections.title: How to read the map

sections.html: Google Image Search is queried for the term [“climate change”]. The top 1.000 images outputted by the engine are manually analysed and categorized. Each category is assigned a value corresponding to the number of images that refer to that topic and is visualized in a treemap.
